meanings.definition: a type of white grape used in winemaking
meanings.sent1: The vineyard was full of trebbianos ready to be harvested.
meanings.sent2: The winemaker selected the finest trebbianos for the new batch of wine.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the trebbianos for tiny balls to play with.
meanings.sent4: The trebbianos glistened in the sunlight like precious pearls on a vine.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the ripe trebbianos filled the air with a sweet fragrance.

meanings.definition: relating to or characteristic of the Trebbiano grape
meanings.sent1: The trebbianos vines stretched across the field, showcasing their unique leaves.
meanings.sent2: The winery offered a tasting of their trebbianos wines to the visitors.
meanings.sent3: The trebbianos grape seemed to wink playfully in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as refreshing as a glass of chilled trebbianos wine.
meanings.sent5: The trebbianos essence in the air hinted at the upcoming harvest season.

meanings.definition: the act of harvesting or cultivating Trebbiano grapes
meanings.sent1: The farmers trebbianos the vineyard early in the morning.
meanings.sent2: She trebbianos with care and precision to ensure a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully pretended to trebbianos the imaginary grapevines.
meanings.sent4: The community came together to trebbianos the grapes for the annual festival.
meanings.sent5: The winery workers trebbianos the ripe grapes into crates for processing.
